html:
To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, youâ€™ll find 11 new shows (including Mythic Quest spinoff Side Quest, Matt Bomer and Nathan Lane in Mid-Century Modern, and Seth Rogen in The Studio), seven returning favorites (including Bosch: Legacy, The Cleaning Lady and The Conners) and seven finales (including The Bachelor, Reacher and When Calls the Heart).

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email usÂ and your question may be answered in Mattâ€™s Inside Line.

SUNDAY, MARCH 23

ðŸ“º 8:30 pm Grimsburg midseason finale (Fox, next day on Hulu)

ðŸ“º 9 pm David Blaine: Do Not Attempt (NatGeo)
Blaine takes us on a journey through extraordinary cultures, where he meets with kindred spirits who inspire and share with him exceptional skills (and secrets).

ðŸ“º 9 pm Wolf Hall: The Mirror and the Light (PBS)
Starring Mark RylanceÂ andÂ Damian Lewis, this isÂ theÂ last chapter to finishÂ theÂ story started inÂ WolfÂ Hall, a trilogy tracing Thomas Cromwellâ€™s rise to power inÂ theÂ court of Henry VIII.

From the seemingly cursed dynasties like theÂ Von ErichÂ wrestling family to iconic figures likeÂ 7thÂ Heavenâ€™sÂ pastor dadÂ Stephen Collins,Â who are far from their beloved characters, and series plagued by peril and misfortune likeÂ Mighty Morphin Power RangersÂ andÂ The Real Housewives,Â this new series unveils the shadowy underbelly of Hollywood.

WEDNESDAY, MARCH 26

ðŸ“º Million Dollar Secret (Netflix, three-episode premiere)
Twelve strangers enter a sumptuous lakeside estate and in each of their rooms is a mysterious welcome gift â€” a box. Eleven of them are empty and one contains $1,000,000, and itâ€™s for that guest to keep â€” as long as they keep their identity hidden.

ðŸ“º Side Quest (Apple TV+, four-episode binge)
The Mythic Quest spinoff explores the lives of employees, players and fans who are impacted by the game.

ðŸ“º The Studio (Apple TV+, two-episode premiere)
Seth Rogen plays the newly appointed head of a fictitious Hollywood film studio.

Narrated by Uma Thurman, the docuseries showcases the power of nature in helping to restore and stabilize our ecosystems. Â

THURSDAY, MARCH 27

ðŸ“º Gold & Greed: The Hunt for Fennâ€™s Treasure (Netflix, three-episode binge)
The docuseries centers on an eccentric man who sets off a real-life treasure hunt when he hides a chest of gold in the Rockies â€” and hides clues in a cryptic poem.
